wikipedia_page.main: Sir Ernest Joseph Soares (20 October 1864 – 15 March 1926), of 36 Princes Gate, London, and of Upcott House  in the parish of Pilton, near Barnstaple in North Devon, was a British solicitor and Liberal politician.

response: *Ernest Soares, Bardez origin, Junior Lord of the Treasury and former Member of Parliament for Barnstaple

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1900 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the January 1910 United Kingdom general election
List of Lords Commissioners of the Treasury

response: The by-election was caused by the appointment of the sitting Liberal MP, Ernest Soares as Junior Lord of the Treasury, i.e. one of the government whips.The Times, 21 February 1910 p14  Under the Parliamentary rules of the day applicable to the appointment of ministers, Soares had to resign and fight a by-election.

he married Kate Rose Mary Soares (b. 1894), sole daughter and heiress of Sir Ernest Soares (1864-1926), of 36 Princes Gate, London, and of Upcott House in the parish of Pilton, North Devon, a solicitor and Liberal Party Member of Parliament.

link_mentions.page: List of ethnic minority politicians in the United Kingdom
List of ministerial by-elections to the Parliament of the United Kingdom

response: A number of British Indians and Anglo-Indians were elected to the British parliament, particularly from the Parsi and Jewish communities. They included Dadabhai Naoroji, Mancherjee Bhownagree, Shapurji Saklatvala, Philip Sassoon and Ernest Soares.

*Kate Lord, who married her father's near-neighbour Ernest Soares (1864-1926), then a solicitor in Manchester residing at Woodheys,Website created and compiled by Charlie Hulme and Lis Nicolson, with the assistance of the John Cassidy Committee, Slane History & Archaeology Society. on Washway Road, in Ashton upon Mersey (today Sale), later a Liberal Member of Parliament for Barnstaple, Devon.
